name: Doris Bell
text:
This is in response to my son, David Bell's review.  He was upset when I told him that after Answered Prayer finished their service in my home I found several items missing.  Several months later, the missing items were returned to me by someone that I knew and not connected to Answered Prayer.  It was then that I realized that  Answered Prayer had nothing to do with the missing items.  I have apologized to Answered Prayer.  They have responded in a most gracious way and accepted my apology.

Dear      :

I am writing this letter in regards to accusing your employees of theft last year.  I apologize for my mistake.  The items I accused them of taking have been returned to me.

Once again, I apologize to Answered Prayers and these employees for my wrongful accusation and pray that you will forgive me.
Sincerely,

Doris Bell

I had accused back in 2020

resp.text: Thank You So much

name: Susan Stringer
text: Knowing that this home care service is owned locally makes a big difference.  Not only am I happy to support a locally owned agency they are extremely professional and do an amazing job caring for their clients.  The owners are a big part of our community and are real fine folks.  I highly recommend Answered Prayer Home Care.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We sure do appreciate hearing this feedback.

name: Arla Chandler
text: Once again Answered Prayer was a fantastic referral for a family friend. They visited once a week to give the family some time away from the home knowing their loved one was well cared for.  Thank you so much Answered Prayer team for always being the best!

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We sure do appreciate hearing this feedback.

name: Brittany Willis
text: Can not say enough great things about Answered Prayer! The staff is helpful, professional, and companionate. Would highly recommend this company to anyone looking for in-home care!

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review. We sure do appreciate hearing this feedback.

name: joan williams
text: In a time when we need consistency for our loved one, this agency has failed to deliver. Workers have no training on the basics from using wheelchairs to attending to basic needs. Workers report late and leave early...even asking to bring their kids along to a work location.  There is a different worker each day which does not give an opportunity for a relationship to develop between client and worker. They take advantage of elderly and/or sick clients if there is no one to advocate for them. I am disappointed. We have been patient, however, our needs have not been met.

resp.text: Thank you for providing constructive feedback that we can share with our team. It is our utmost priority to accommodate  families providing comfort, relief, and reassurance during a challenging time. Our goal is to work with families to create a constructive relationship meant to serve and provide care when families need it most. A member of our management team will be in contact to resolve any communication or service issues that may have occurred.  Thank you again for bringing this matter to our attention. Our management team is available to meet and revise a plan of care always. Please don't hesitate to reach out.

name: David Bell
text: Do not use this company;  we had several items stolen and the company said they would follow up and then stopped responding.  Terrible experience at the worst time possible.  Follow up - I was contacted about the review and Answered Prayer did not wish to make it right (without proof through a police conviction).  If you hire them, make sure your valuables are locked up.

resp.text: Answered Prayer Home Care is a locally owned highly reputable and trusted home care service in the River Region. We thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention. As a leader in home care we are bound to a high standard of ethical and moral integrity, prideful of our outstanding caregivers who have been employed without incident for many years.  We place high standards on following protocols at all times.  It is our hope in the future when you or a loved one requires in home care you will consider choosing the integrity of Answered Prayer Home Care Services.

name: Charlotte Cearley
text: So very thankful for Answered Prayer, and Irene.  This group has sent us very qualified and caring folks.  When S had to leave, we were immediately blessed by another caring person, Irene.  So many days, she lifts all our spirits as she lovingly cares for our mom.  Meghann, too, has been invaluable in helping us think things through.  Very grateful for the hard work of this group!

resp.text: Thank you!  We are always trying to do our absolute best.  I will share this with our team.  They will appreciate your kind words.

name: Mandy Beeson
text: Would not recommend! I used this service for less than a year and had to request new caregivers multiple times because of issues with each one. The first one asked to buy all kinds of things from my home, as well as wanting to bring her Internet boyfriend over to meet my mom. Not ok. I don’t think their staff is trained to deal with Alzheimer’s patients and I had one “caregiver” who constantly argued with and agitated my mother. I finally decided that I was done with this company. I paid my last bill and they deposited the check, then tried to send my bill to a collection lawyer! Steer clear of this service!

name: Richard Crabtree
text: Thank you for everything. You guys were great

resp.text: Thank you Richard. We always strive to do our best.  Appreciate your feedback!

name: Del Chick
text: I retracted my negative statement because John White, the owner of the company took care of the situation and was very apologetic, and he will handle the problem for my mother. He said it was a major miscommunication and I’ve accepted  that. You just have to reach out until you get the owner of a company and explain it to them, they’re usually more than helpful, as he has now been.   He Immediately went right out to see my mother! And we have a resolution worked out. Thank you very much John ! 👍

resp.text: UPDATE Hi Del!  We so appreciate working with you and appreciate you reaching out to us.  Have a super day!

name: Peggy Johnson
text: Very comforting to my family.  Was also very professional and companionate in caring to my daughter during the final time of her life.

name: Mandy Beeson
text: Would not recommend! I used this service for less than a year and had to request new caregivers multiple times because of issues with each one. The first one asked to buy all kinds of things from my home, as well as wanting to bring her Internet boyfriend over to meet my mom. Not ok. I don’t think their staff is trained to deal with Alzheimer’s patients and I had one “caregiver” who constantly argued with and agitated my mother. I finally decided that I was done with this company. I paid my last bill and they deposited the check, then tried to send my bill to a collection lawyer! Steer clear of this service!

name: Morgan A
text:
I would not recommend anyone to use this company to help their loved ones. AnswerPrayer is the most disloyal, unprofessional, and unorganized home health company in Alabama.
They also dont give frequent drug screenings to their employees who's out there making mistakes on the job.
Megan Wikof is NOT to be trusted, don't let her poker face fool you!!!

resp.text: Hi Morgan. We are very disappointed to learn of your dissatisfaction with our service provider.  Trust that we are evaluating any dissatisfied feedback that results from interacting with our company.  We will throughly research the comments above and will be sure to handle this with care, accuracy and professionalism.  We strive to always improve and your feedback will be evaluated constructively.  If you have an opportunity to review us again and can improve our rating we would appreciate the evaluation.

name: Carol-Ann Stewart
text:
Synergy Homecare was the perfect agency to support my dad’s stroke recovery. I needed a little extra help each weekday morning while my dad was on home health and his care giver (Brandon) really helped him gain his strength back.

Synergy was very responsive and very easy to work with, I highly recommend this company.

resp.text: Thank you Carol-Ann it was an honor to provide care for your dad.

name: Delaris Juitt
text: The office staff and caregiver are excellent Connie makes sure to provide the right caregiver to their patients.  Also counsel the caregiver on what the patients need.

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Juitt. We appreciate you!

name: Jan D
text: The caregivers we had were compassionate and loving. Helpful and caring. They took a load off our minds for sure. Synergy was easy to work with, as well. Thank you so much.

resp.text: Thank you Jan.

name: Tracey Sheets
text: I continue to be impressed by all the staff at Synergy Home Health. Especially Mrs Keisha. I feel like they really care about the patient and as my husband’s caregiver, I feel very supported by Synergy. Everyone has been so nice and helpful. I’m extremely grateful I connected with Synergy.

resp.text: Thank you Tracey for your kind words!

name: Aleshia Walker
text: Working for SYNERGY has been an extremely positive experience.  The whole organization truly cares about providing quality care and support to each client, and is in this business for all of the right reasons.  They are available 24/7 and work hard to accommodate their clients' scheduling needs.  The office staff truly cares for each client like family and we have wonderful caregivers.  I'm excited to see what the future holds for Synergy HomeCare!

resp.text: Thanks Aleshia, we are blesses to have you on our team.

name: Jenny Hallyburton
text: Synergy has great customer service and the management team has always been helpful. Scott and Lynn are always willing to meet families and answer any questions they may have. I highly recommend this sitter service.

resp.text: Thanks Jenny!

name: Amy Whittenburg
text: My mother is in late stage Alzheimer's and the caregivers have been wonderful with her.  They are very skilled and have the knowledge to deal with my mom on a daily basis.  They bathe, feed, keep her engaged and love on her.  Could not ask for a better company to take care of my mom.

resp.text: Thank you Amy!  We love working with your mom!

name: Lady Te
text:
I will not be with this company much longer due to low pay, plus I found a wonderful family that I will be working for with much better pay. I love what I do and plan on staying in this line of work but love doesn’t pay the bills or put food on the table and clothe my children. I loathe being forced to work overtime just to make ends meet which takes time away from my family. I really do wish things were different because I absolutely love the company and some of the management. I just wish they paid based on experience but they don’t. If you are experienced you will be making the same as someone who has never done this before and are afraid of the elderly. They really do there best to show appreciation for there caregivers and cna’s but trust me, the best thing to do is pay your experienced employees a decent livable wage.

You can bet that whenever you see “competitive wages” on the job application just know that means you will be paid little to nothing and a decent check depends on how desperate you are for the money and if you aren’t desperate enough to do a boat load of overtime then don’t waste your time.

I will say that Scott and Lynn are wonderful people and they are flexible with your shifts so you’ll be able to work what fits you best. Keisha, Kathleen and Santrece are so warm and wonderful to work with.

I’d say this job is great for beginners and students who plan on going into medical. Although we do not provide skilled nursing like a Ltcf it is the basics and allows you to get your feet wet. I love the company but I’ve outgrown it and just because it’s no longer a good fit for me, doesn’t mean I will not recommend this company to reliable people who need work. I’ve already sent some people Synergys’ way.

name: T0785
text: Thank you so much for your great care for our patients and staff at Arbor Springs!

resp.text: Thank you Taresa!

name: Nicole Gachett
text: Awesome staff and great welcoming atmosphere upon entry of the office.

resp.text: Thanks Nicole, you're awsome!

name: Dwayne Long
text: These are some truly amazing people who take  very good measures to insure that you are receiving the best possible care for what is going on and helps you understand all aspects of your care. And it helps that they have a great  attitude and outlook for helping people to understand.

resp.text: Thanks Dwayne!

name: Janine Rumker
text: Right from the very beginning, Shasta from Synergy made us feel welcome and cared for. She was patient and kind with my mother, who recently had a heart attack and had a stent put in. My mother is a caregiver, not used to accepting help and certainly a very proud and private person. She did NOT want any help, certainly not with bathing. Shasta knew just whom to send...Michelle. What a blessing! My mom went from not wanting any help, to wanting to take Michelle with her to her home in Florida! Michelle was so kind and understanding. She did things without being told, was efficient and sweet. I can't say enough good things about our first experience with home care. Thank you so much Synergy!

resp.text:
Janine,
Taking care of your mother was such a blessing. Michelle told us many times how much she enjoyed their time together. We wish the best for your mother in Florida and we will miss her.
Thank you again,
Shasta Kromer

name: venus9 Cotton
text: I have never work there but I heard some good thing's

text: I started with Synergy last year it's a great place to work and the staff is very friendly and the schedules are flexible 😊

resp.text: Thanks, Urica!

name: Gretchen McKenzie
text: I have been working for synergy for two years and I love my job and they’re great people to work with.I give five stars to this awesome company!

resp.text: Thank you Gretchen!  We appreciate you so much!

name: Erin Carter
text: Great staff and so compassionate!

resp.text: Thanks Erin!

name: Santrice McClure
text: I start as a caregiver in 2015 when they first open up. I work in the field i absolutely love working for Synergy Home Care and the owners a very understand and i love working with them.

resp.text: You are an awesome caregiver.

name: Bruce Trowbridge
text:
My 94 year old mom fell and fractured her L1 vertebra the day after Christmas.  She was bed ridden for a couple of months due to the pain, and after the fracture healed remained bed ridden and on oxygen due to progressing congestive heart failure.  This lasted almost 6 months until she passed, with the last 4 months under in-home hospice care.  My mom lived with me, since she (and the rest of the family) did not want her last days to be in a nursing home.  I am a single man and with the constant care my mom required, I could not handle it on my own, I needed caregiving help.  I contracted out 60 hours every week for caregiving and I took the other 128 hours myself.

I contracted with BrightStar based on recommendations from friends, and I was not disappointed.   BrightStar provided qualified care givers, and if mom and/or did not relate well with a particular care giver, BrightStar would provide a different one.  We eventually evolved to a core set of 2 regular care givers, loved by my mom and I,  covering all 60 hours per week.  I don’t know if other companies would be this flexible and supportive.  If a regular caregiver could not come, BrightStar would notify me and fill the gap, so that I could always count on a caregiver at my home at the planned schedule.  Knowing that a caregiver will be there, rain or shine, is a major consideration when determining if you want to hire a known private individual or a company with lots of caregivers.  Additionally, BrightStar schedulers, nurse, business office personnel were always a pleasure to work with and very supportive of mom and I during these trying time.  BrightStar may not be the cheapest, but you can count on them, so you just set your hours to what you can afford.  I highly recommend BrightStar, and if the need for caregiving arises for me in the future, I will be calling them.

name: Mary Cashulette
text: I had a horrible infection. This group is unbelievably professional and caring. Christy Jones came up with the idea of using a vac. My surgeon didn’t think about that. I trusted Brightstar more than him and was able to heal well. Thank you so much! Highly recommend!

name: Anna Elizabeth Jones
text: 100% client oriented.

name: Tati Monű
text: Great place great staff and caregivers

resp.text: Thank you!  We are pleased to be able to provide our services to the local, Huntsville community!

name: Tiffany Walker
text: I used this company for their tanning membership. They do home care but offer tannin beds in their office. I called first to ask info and they was very polite and knowledgeable about their services. I went today and it was clean and neat inside. Great beds, great friendly service. Thankyou

name: Karen Canary
text: DO NOT TAKE YOUR LOVED ONE HERE. My father was in horrific shape when we took him home from this facility! He had a terrible rash from being left in soiled clothing for hours on end. He seemed to have lost his ability to speak until about a week after he came back home. It was like they gave him a lobotomy! He went in because he was having issues walking and came out unable to STAND, or COMMUNICATE! It took about two weeks for him to RECOVER from being at Encompass! Now he is back to his normal self, but still can't walk. How sad is that? He was treated more as an inconvenience rather than a human being! NEVER AGAIN!

resp.text: Hi Karen, we’re sorry to hear about your father's experience and would like to learn more about the situation. Can you please email HHH.Contact@encompasshealth.com with additional details?

name: Lisa Feher
text:
I want to thank Joy Valentino
.for bringing a ray of sunshine into my life and recovery from knee replacement!She is indeed a treasure....i will miss her greatly!Anyone lucky enough to.have her come to their home will benefit!God bless u honey..ur so missed😥😍
.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing, Lisa!

name: Regina Carnley
text: My mother in law loves her nurse from Encompass and also loves her Physical Therapist. She is doing so much better now.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing and for entrusting us with your mother-in-law's care, Regina!

name: Billy S.
text: Disappointed. Encompass was caring for my dad. He started coughing up blood and bits of tissue, and when this was brought to the attention of the nurse,  she claimed it was normal in COPD patients. They released him from they're care very shortly after, stating he's getting better. Less than a month has passed, and were here at enterprise medical center because of pneumonia. It was found out he has a tumor in each lung, one the size of a tennis ball. Hows this getting better??

resp.text: Billy, we apologize for the delay in our response and have forwarded this information to the appropriate contacts. If you’d like to share additional details, please email us directly at HHH.Contact@encompasshealth.com.

name: Jeffery Tatum
text: My father was recently discharged and is doing great now! Great job!

resp.text: So glad to hear your experience with Encompass Health was great! Thanks for sharing, Jeffery.

name: James Barley
text: Best home health agency! Staff is very caring and attentive. Would highly recommend them to anyone!

resp.text: We agree, James! Our Encompass Health employees are the best. Thanks for sharing.

name: Jasmine Tierra
text: I came here from Montgomery to earn my CNA license and I had an offer for a job interview back home in one of the local hospital’s emergency  departments before I even finished the program! Totally worth it as opposed to other programs that take up to 18+ weeks. My instructor Natasha was the bomb! She really wants her students to succeed and fully equips you for the field. I miss it there!

resp.text: Jasmine you were a great student and person and we wish you nothing but success in life. Thank you for taking the time to review our program.

name: Savanna Upshaw
text: I took the MA program at saads and everybody there are absolutely amazing

name: Deirdre Snyder
text: Rude, rude, staff. No professionalism whatsoever. The staff could not care any less about helping you or being even the least bit friendly or polite. I wanted to do business with a local company instead of ordering online, but they’ve made it impossible. This is my second visit and the last time I will shop with them.

name: Krystal Littrell
text: We use SAAD for my mother who is on Home Health Care and they are wonderful. They work around your schedule and it's a wonderful relief for me to have nurses and CNA'S come out to help woth her care.

name: Lannie Shearls
text: The staff that came to my home was very attentive and did their job but management was uncooperative and rude and did not give our doctor the correct information.

name: Kurstin Nicole
text: I Do Not Recommend! I took the MA Course in Aug 2018 & I still haven’t landed a job. Nonetheless an interview. Some of my fellow classmates also haven’t had any luck. Don’t get me wrong the MA instructor was excellent. I have no complaints about her. I just feel that for the price you’re paying they should have a job placement program after finishing the course to help their students land a job. I wrote them asking about if they had a job placement program like the other Technical schools just to have my message left on read. Very unprofessional. It took for me to message them a second time just for them to respond. They don’t care about their students & their life after the program. All they care about is the money. Don’t do it. Go somewhere else.

name: Kay Bradley
text: The Staff is beyond amazing. I’ve used them for years for my Parents Homehealth needs and now for my Husband’s Hospice service. I haven’t encountered one member from this awesome team yet that don’t exceed all expectations. Truly an amazing group. From the store to the Nurses, Aides, Social Workers, even just someone that answers the phone. You can feel their genuine love and compassion for everyone.

name: Jessica Deese
text:
Katlyn and Courtney found 24/7 in home health care workers in record time. They were relentless in their pursuit of getting the help
We needed in an incredibly short time frame. So grateful for their help!

name: Diane Faris
text:
We have been using Saads for years as a source for in home care. I have been very happy with the nurses and aids that have cared for me as well as the physical therapists that have helped me. Sometimes one has to be patient with the logistics of appointments for in home care but other than that I would recommend this company whole
heartedly. Recently my husband went under Hospice care in our home. One aid Erica was so outstanding  in her care for my husband that she was a true blessing. He had a wonderful nurse, Latoya, who went above and beyond the call of duty . She is an outstanding nurse who truly cares for her patience’s needs and those of the family.

resp.text: Mrs Faris, we are very thankful for your kind words and recognition of two outstanding employees. We will work to continue to improve the logistics of delivering care in the homes of our community and believe the time is coming when patience is always appreciated but only needed for special circumstances. We plan to provide a gift to the two employees mentioned as a way of thanking them for making a difference in the life and care of your husband. You have our gratitude and love.

name: Hannah Derouen
text: Would highly recommend SAAD’s. I personally know a lot of the staff and they are incredible people that truly care about their patients. They have cared for my grandparents as well.

name: lcp191
text:
Don’t get me wrong, the hospice facility is absolutely beautiful, and the nurses are very friendly, but the way my family member was treated after they passed was very disrespectful.

They had passed early in the morning, and I was reassured they would call to have his body transported ASAP. They covered his body with a sheet, left him in the room, and there he sat from 5:30 AM until 6:00 at night. At noon, I asked what was taking so long, and was reassured they would be here shortly. I asked again at 2:30, and was told the same. Finally at 4 I went to the admin office, and they forgot to call. After they finally called, they were picking up his body within 2 hours.

They were very apologetic, but they need to improve on communication.

And although this did occur, I still wouldn’t hesitate to recommend someone to this facility if they needed it, it is definitely the best in the area. I visited probably 5-6, and the others had as much as 20:1 patient to nurse ratio, while this was 6:1 I believe. Food was good, and for the most part the nurses were all friendly.

resp.text: Lcp191, I appreciate your kind words about our care but I am deeply saddened with your report as nothing short of five star experience is acceptable to us.  It is an honor to care for patients and family members during this time. We respect this time very much and would never want a family to feel we are rushing to get their loved one out of our hospice retreat. Also, we are very much aware of when a patient has passed and work with our local funeral homes to make sure transport is arranged promptly. I am unable to determine what loved one you are referencing with this experience after passing and I ask that you call us and reference your review to speak with either our program director or with our Vice President. They are both hoping to hear from you so we can learn from your experience and make sure we deliver tremendous love and dignity for all patients and families we have the honor to care for.  251.380.3810

name: Robyn Danielle
text: I took the Phlebotomy course. The instructor was knowledgeable and made the class fun. I would recommend to anyone.

name: JahMyiah Pollock
text: I took the phlebotomy class and the instructor, Vic Walton, was AMAZING! Vic is the funniest man i know but he is also the best teacher i ever had! It’s a great learning experience; he will teach you everything you need to know and the second week you’ll be sticking patients at the hospital. It is a GREAT experience and it is definitely worth the money!!!

name: Kim
text: This place is EXACTLY what is says SAAD as hell!!! Do not use this company!!!! Especially Ms. Fulghum! This woman has no manners and is mean as a snake! STAY AWAY!!!!!

resp.text: Kim, your post unfortunately doesn't offer much in the way for us to improve. Saad is an arabic name as John E. Saad was the founder. His parents immigrated to this area from Lebanon and Mr Saad was very proud of his heritage and therefore named the company Saad Healthcare. Saad in Arabic actually means happiness, prosperity, success and good luck. Although you may have not had that kind of experience with our company, we do wish you happiness, prosperity and good luck in life. Your one other review on google seemed to indicate you have had other experiences where you reference someone you did not like and I hope you will post some reviews of places that bring you more happiness than the two you have chosen to review.

name: Kayla Robinson
text: I give Saad healthcare training and education service a 5 star! I had a great experience and received a lot of support to succeed in obtaining my phlebotomy certification. I was referred to this school from a local relative and I live out of town, coming from Massachusetts.I highly recommend coming to this school! My classmates and instructor were phenomenal. I gained so much knowledge about phlebotomy while attending. Thank you!

name: Tye Roberson
text: The Phlebotomy class was all I expected it to be, I really enjoyed the clinical portion and the hands on training. Our instructor Vic was AWESOME... a very knowledgeable patient individual who knows his craft. Hats off to Saad Heathcare for having such a well rounded instructor to teach. I'd refer anyone to take this class under Vic's leadership.

name: Suzanne Karam
text: The best constructed wheelchair I have had. The Saad's courier delivered my wheelchair to me at the hospital because I was being discharged on Sunday afternoon. Excellent quality in the equipment, and excellent quality of service from Saad's---the Patient Care Specialist, working in concert with the hospital staff, pursued my needs very efficiently and with precision. The physical therapists and nurses have been delightful!

name: Elizabeth Peterson
text: Saad has great customer service and if you have an order paid for by insurance that needs a pickup and advise what time you will arrive they have it ready at that time for you. Or just as you arrive so you will not have to wait at all.

name: Shantrel Patrick
text: My personal experience has been a wonderful one. The staff at Saad are both professional and efficient. I recently received my certification in phlebotomy and my instructor, Mr. Vic, was amazing. In just 3 weeks, he managed to teach everything we needed to know, to CONFIDENTLY & SUCCESSFULLY perform a phlebotomy in any arena, all while giving a good laugh.

name: Dylan Clayton
text: The nurse's are nice and the man cooking food is 11/10. Food is good did not expect that.

name: K B
text: I just finished the phlebotomy course and Vic is one of the best instructors I have ever been given the opportunity to learn from! Vic makes the class fun all while learning what you need to know to become a great phlebotomist. The hours may seem long but with such an amazing instructor that goes out of his way to make sure each individual learns and goes on to succeed in this job field the time fly's by. I would recommend Saad and Vic Walton 100 percent.

name: Heather Board
text: Took the phlebotomy course with Vic Walton, 100% would recommend anyone wanting to take this course to make sure he is the instructor. Our class of 3 weeks was well informative and we all passed the class and medca exam with A's. Vic trys his hardest to get you a job afterwards and makes sure you get the best out of your money.

name: Ashley Burke
text: I just graduated from the phlebotamy program and it has been one of the best decisions I have ever made! I wasn't confident at first, but with my instructor, Vic Walton, I became extremely confident in my abilities very quickly! He's a great teacher and full of a lot of knowledge. 10/10 would recommend this class to anyone.

name: Kayla Porter
text:
I took the phlebotomy course in October, Vic Walton was my instructor. I couldn't be more pleased with my time there. Vic was more than helpful and did everything in his power to make sure that we were on track, no one was ever left behind. Honestly I would recommend this course to anyone who's looking for a change and who is looking to be certified. All of the instructors are wonderful and it was an experience that I will keep with me forever.

2 months after I finished the classes and relocated to Florida, I was employed with lifesouth and every day I go to work and enjoy what I do.
I appreciate my time at SAAD more than you know and I hope that anyone who is considering taking this opportunity decides to give it a shot because you won't regret it.

name: Milissa Ziegler
text: I tried to have a prescription for medical equipment approved through this company and every time I call they gave me a different excuse as to why it’s was not processed and said they needed more information from my doctor. My doctors office gave them more information and there would be another excuse. This was for a nebulizer which I needed. I also try to use them two years ago when I had knee surgery and I had the same issue. I would not recommend this company to anyone

She was working serving the Saad family creating memorable moments for their family on every holiday. For over 50 yrs she did this & shared many stories of how they treated her & the things she would suffer if she did try to take off. What a very heartless family! I would always tell her mama please let me say something to them this is not right! They are violating labor laws & your civil rights, she would say “no this is not the time” me being an obedient child would always obey my mother wishes. They stood up @ her funeral and spoke on how much they loved their dear Marybelle which was a lie, they loved what Marybelle could do for their family. FOR GOD SO LOVED THE WORLD THAT HE GAVE!!! GOD GAVE, HE ADDED VALUE NOT TAKE IT AWAY!!! That’s what love does!!! My mother is gone to her Heavenly Home, now it’s time to tell the story. The true story!!!

text: I paid $800 for a phlebotomy class and did not receive the correct amount of clinical training hours. Therefore only 5 of my classmates came and unfortunately the other ones could not because it was a Saturday. In which means they were not able to do any clinical hours. Unfortunately that was the ONLY 4 clinical hours for the entire complete 3wk.program. My classmates and I were cheated out of $800. Not a place to go for a phlebotomy training class. Don't waste your money. Go somewhere else and get the proper amount of training and clinical hours for your money's worth.

name: takira baxter
text: I attended a college where we received 160 clinical hours and up to 150 pokes in our phlebotomy course program. The phlebotomy program at Saad's no where near provided this to their students. My friend's instructor stayed texting and looking at the phone a lot while trying to teach them.  Clinical hours are the entire main key to having the knowledge, skills, and abilities to drawing blood. Saad's did not provide them or give them any clinical hours at all so they were lacking terrible skills and abilities of drawing blood because of the no clinical hours and lack of training. All the students complained and felt like the only thing they paid for was a phlebotomy button Saad's gave them after they were finished with the program. A hope to get job in the med.field but not a living off of job. Plus it's a very challenging job to get because too many people are trying to get a license for it so it is too much competition. Majority of jobs only hire experienced workers with 2+years of experience because they are afraid that you may cause a patient to have a permanently injured arm (hematoma) so they do not take risk. A permanent injury can cause the patient to sue the hospital. Volunteer programs do not offer many openings either because they are also afraid that you may cause an injury to a patient's arm so they do not take a risk on non experience phlebotomy technicians either. So be careful with this chose of career because it is no where near guaranteed to get a job for a while. And hospitals are starting to let RN nurses do more drawing blood than phlebotomist. So it makes it even harder to get a phlebotomy job. I also recommend and advise you to attend a college that offers the same cost for this program, more training, clinical hours, and you may have a better chance of getting a job. Because jobs trust colleges way more than a student who attended a healthcare place offering a program. Especially not Saad's due to their lack of non clinical hours and training.Take my advice seriously.

I used the device one time and it is too hard to use.  I tried to return the clean and undamaged item to the store approximately 14 days after the purchase.  The salesman declined to return the item and his manager backed him up.  The sales receipt does state they have a 7 day return window but in my case I was unable to return the item in the stated time period.  Although there are several more expensive items that SAAD carries that I need to purchase,  I will take my business to a SAAD competitor.  Potential SAAD customers beware of purchasing an item that is extremely hard to use and beware of the lack of flexibility in the SAAD item return policy. SO SAAD.

Mr. Yonts, we are very sorry about your experience at Saad Medical.  We would like to fully refund you and hope that you would trust us in helping with any future purchases. Please contact David Parnell our store manager at (251) 287-8933 or stop by our location on University BLVD. name: Cyndy Dowling
text:
I was pretty much directed to this merchant by my MD. I had a broken bone in my foot. A friend drove me from my MD visit over to this merchant  and I hobbled inside.  I knew I would need to present my insurance information cards and make a payment.

The employee desks are situated at the very back of the room beyond the product displays. "For sale" reclining and lift chairs are located to the left,  then there is a huge group of walkers, wheel chairs, bathing safety seats etc located in the middle section of the store. Neither employee visible got up when we entered the store.

An employee called out something to us from the desk area.

My friend encouraged me to sit in the first reclining chair but as it was a floor product I hesitated to do this and  continued towards the back of the store towards the employees.  One of the employees finally said, "you can sit in one of those chairs".

I AM trying to make a long story short.

I ended up buying a cast boot, but they informed me that they did not take my insurance so I paid out of pocket for the item.

The first boot they tried on me was way too big and they quoted me a price of $89.00 for the item.

In the end they sold me a higher valued, smaller product at close to the price they originally quoted, so I will give them credit for honoring the price they quoted. That is why 2 stars rather than 1 star. (I think the real reason I got the lower price was because my friend advocated for me regarding the price. I could not hear what was said,  because I was still sitting over against the wall in a recliner,  and my friend was over at one of the staff desks.)

The staff did not appear to know or understand their products very well and did not really explain much about the boot I bought. They were not gentle or accommodating of my injured foot which was covered in a sock, but swollen and quite painful. The boot was not put on my foot/leg correctly. The tops of the two rigid metal posts that are covered in a hard, rough, scratchy Velcro product were up above the padding of the boot.  After a bit of struggling by the employees, I really just wanted to finish the process and get out of the store. My foot hurt and nothing they were doing was helping at all.  Later, after I got home,  my husband and I looked at the picture on the cast boot box.  The picture clearly showed the boot padding extending up above the two rigid metal posts.

The posts had already sanded away the skin on both sides of my calf/shin. My husband reassembled the boot correctly and put it back on my foot after putting bandages on the two sores on my calf.

This store needs to rethink the showroom set up. The employees and their desks should be located near the door.  I realize that their product storage and office space are located at the back of the store but they ARE selling medical devices for customers who probably have some kind of limitation. The employees are the ones who should be making the trek across the store. It might also be a good idea for them to have a wheelchair available just inside the door that they could direct a customer to, if needed,  as soon as they entered.  This would be another advantage to the employees being stationed near the door.

Let me be clear. No one was rude to us, but, no one seemed very concerned either. The first girl who tried to help us must have been new and was not familiar with the  boot products.

This necessitated a second, presumably more experienced staff member also assisting us. The second staff member was pretty obviously not pleased that she had to become involved and was very abrupt with the first staff member.

All in all it is not an experience I would repeat.

After I got home and was finally comfortable with the cast boot, I looked up cast boots on Amazon and I could have gotten a comparable or even better product at half the price. And, Amazon has great customer service.

name: Debbie Garrett
text:
I’ve been a caregiver for many years.   When we moved to Athens a couple months ago I felt it time to get back to what I love...caring for the elderly!
Working with Amy and Jeremy has been a very nice experience!!!   They are kind and understanding of scheduling issues we as caregivers may have.   While I’ve only been with Visiting Angels of Florence for a short time,  I already feel blessed to be part of the team to provide the best care to our elderly clients as possible!!!

name: Lindsey Watford
text: The owners, Amy and Jeremy, really go above and beyond to make sure their clients have all of their needs covered. I have personally witnessed them both take time away from their own families and personal lives to put the needs of the client first. You couldn’t ask for a better company to take care of your loved one.

name: Stacey Ronillo
text: The caregivers and office staff at Visiting Angels were amazing to my mother(and helped us as well really).  We are so please to have used such a wonderful, caring and compassionate company when mom needed a little extra help.  Thank you!

resp.text: It was our pleasure!  Thank you for choosing Visiting Angels and writing such a nice review!

name: Michael Hamilton
text: It's centrally located on 6th. North. The staff is friendly and helpful and great job. If your looking for a career,  here it is.

name: Kat Neal
text: Used this company recently. AMAZING!! Would recommend. Staff was extremely helpful and attentive to my dad's needs. Affordable pricing in comparison to others in area.

name: Sarah M
text: Always There has been a blessing for both my family and families that we have referred. From the first call we knew we chose the right company. The nurses that came into our home were wonderful and the office staff was always available if we needed to make a change or ask questions. Thank you Always There for all you do!

name: Ann Whitaker
text: It has been a good experience except for a few care givers. I will say that if you are leaving your love ones in the care of strangers. Have some form of in home cameras. Protect them

name: Caroline Laird
text: Always There is a wonderful in-home care company. The staff and nurses genuinely care for their patients and strive to meet each individual’s needs. They have made a huge impact on my family and we are forever thankful for their service and care.

name: Evan B
text: Always There went the extra mile to make sure my grandfather was taken care of, and that he was comfortable with the people in his home. My family was so nervous to start a service like this, knowing that my grandfather can be somewhat particular when it comes to his care and schedule. Always There found us caregivers that became family. Whenever there was a call off, they immediately called to let us know they would have it restaffed ASAP. The owner herself was even involved in my grandfather's care.I do not know what we would have done with out them!

name: Yolanda Williams
text: I have been an employee for Always There for a while.  My experience  there has been fulfilling.  The Staffing and HR Departments are always eager to listen to my dilemmas and offer feedback.  This is a key factor in retaining "good employees".

name: Jenna Ferrara
text: Amazing company that goes above and beyond! They really care about their customers and always do the right thing. Highly recommend!

name: Kaitlin Holley
text: Always There Home Care has been a blessing in my life! They go the extra mile and always take care of my needs!!! Such a great staff!!!! Love this company !

name: Vincent Nelson
text: The service and staff are first-class, when my grandmother was sick they stepped in and supported her and our family like no one else had. I recommend them highly.

name: Amia Loubser

text: I wish I could give them no stars horrible service!!!! They never tell you when someone calls out, and when they do they tell you about 10 mins before its time to be there, staffing people do not care anything about your love one and when you do call for the answering service they never call back!!!!! I would not recommend a dog come here, dont waster you money or your time!!!!

name: Lillie Novak
text: Above and beyond care from all the staff! They really are “Always there” for you and your loved ones.

name: Tammy Holley
text: Very pleased with the dependable and professional service!

name: Jenna Stalica
text: Thankful for companies like "Always There!" FANTASTIC!

name: Joseph Graham
text: This place is a terrible place to eat. It was disgusting.

name: Debbie Young
text: Terrible. If I could give zero stars, I would.

name: Candice Purkey
text: Excellent team!!

name: Frank Giardina
text: Tried to charge me twice, over a year later!

name: Steve Howe
text: It’s rare to have a company who does what they say they are going to do, but we sure did with this company. When they said they would send someone out to get a new caregiver started and trained, they did. When a regular caregiver couldn’t come in they made sure a trained caregiver was there even if it was office professionals (who were former caregivers). They made sure we liked our caregiver and if we had complaints they would take care of it. George (the owner) was so personable and spent a lot of time with us explaining his philosophy on running the most honest, best caregiving experience.  We also enjoyed and appreciated our caregivers for my parents. They worked hard and loved them like their own. If we are ever in the position to need a caregiving service in the future, there will be no doubt who we will use, Your Choice Senior Care.

name: Heather Steel
text: I'm very pleased with the service given by Your Choice Senior Care. George and his team are great, and have helped my dad so much. And they have brought me incredible peace-of-mind.  Not only do they bring him breakfast in the morning (he's at Somerby) but they make sure he gets his medicine 3x a day, talk with him (this has helped his speech tremendously) and help him keep up with some of his light chores and ADLs on the days he needs it. We have found them to be super accommodating with last minute changes and requests, and overall very responsive and caring. Thank you!

name: Catherine Hales
text: This team is always very responsive in helping our seniors. George and Christina are extremely helpful in making sure prompt and quality care is always available. They are one of the few home care companies that require extended training for those with memory loss. A much needed training in this field!

name: Debbie Leirer
text: I cannot say enough good things about "Your Choice Senior Care" and I highly recommend them to anyone that needs senior care assistance.  They have been a godsent for my father.  They are very kind, caring and patient as well as very professional.  They were always on-time for their appointments with my father.  They assisted and trained my father with taking his blood sugar readings and insulin injections.  They offer a variety of services and you can pick the service(s) that best suits your needs.  Their prices are very reasonable.  If you need a senior care professional for your elderly parent, "Your Choice Senior Care" is the first call you should make.

name: Richard Davidson
text:
I highly recommend Your Choice Senior Care for anyone needed help caring for somebody. We’ve relied on Your Choice for well over a year to help care for my 97 year old mother. The company’s owners/managers are conscientious, hard-working, and responsive to our concerns.

One caveat: the quality of individual caregivers varies considerably, from excellent too awful. The best are more than caregivers; they are friends, both with my mom and my wife and myself. A rare few were bad enough I ordered them to leave and not return. The owners and managers are careful with who they hire, and pass on our instructions for what is expected from the caregivers, but they cannot monitor everything happening in your home.  In the end, it is up to you to determine which caregivers meets your needs and which have to go.

That said, anytime there has been problem with a caregiver—no matter the time, day or night—the owners/managers have acted *immediately* to correct the problem, including personally caring for my mom until a replacement caregiver was found.  They strive to provide excellent care to the elderly, and their efforts have made it possible for my mom to continue living with us long after she surpassed our ability to care for her by ourselves.

name: Yvonne Simmons
text:
I am helping a friend who lives out of town with his 94 year old Dad.   We chose Your Choice Senior Care about 2 and a half months ago.  Best decision we have made so far.   He has needed 24/7 care up till about a week ago and we cut back to about 10 hrs and the owners helped us figure best times to have the care givers there.
We were so lost when we first realized we needed this type care and they took care of everything even down to picking up supplies.  They are so hands on and involved.
I can go on and on about this being an A+ company!!!!

Yvonne

name: Valeria Farmer
text: The 18 yr old they sent to help with my mother wanted to do nothing but sit there and watch tv.  We stopped using them and they keep sending invoices to be paid that we're already paid.  It's been months since we used them, but keep getting invoices each month.  The last conversation i had with them, i was informed they owe me money but here it is the next month and they want me to pay them again!  They owe us no money and we sure don't owe them!

name: Vanessa
text: The care and compassion my mother received from Your Choice Senior care made me want to write a review to tell others. I have a busy life and wanted her to be taken care of by professional and caring people during the day and while I was on vacation. If you're looking for help, give them a call and they can do many things to make your life easier.

name: Jevon smith
text: They sent me out 45 miles..an the facility dint allow male caregivers there to sit with woman...they promise me i would still get my 9 hours on my check..THEY SENT ME 16$..please. Stay away from them

name: Leigh Wright
text: They were polite and professional. Definitely made a difficult time easier.

name: Leigh Wright
text: They were friendly and professional. Made caring for my grandmother much easier.

name: Valerie Chavez
text: Such great people!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! Look forward to seeing Mrs. Chavez next week!

name: Kaylee Mendyke
text: The owner of this Senior Helpers, Mrs. Mary, is the most caring and compassionate person I know and truly does so much for her employees and clients. I've been working here at Senior Helpers for about a year and a half and it has been an incredible experience to build a relationship with all of the employees and the clients. I love getting the opportunity to make a positive impact on our client's lives each and every day by keeping them strong, happy, and independent.

name: keshia Robinson
text:
Well, I enjoyed working for Senior Helpers at the beginning. You get to pick your schedule but the pay is only 8 dollars which is below minimum wage. Im a retired Air Force cop, so the pay wasnt really an issue for me. I wanted the experience since I am majoring in Nursing and I wanted to get a start in the healthcare career field. During my time, the clients were all sweethearts and I enjoyed them. They were the best part of my day. It really hurt quitting because I just love the clients and that is why I stayed. Well, some improvements for the company is as follows: better training, pay for the training, and raise the pay. When I first got to my orientation I asked how many employees they have? I was told over 100, but looking at their open shifts this company turn over rate is high and they dont have enough employees that care. They would send out available shifts but on the app employees had to use for myself  it wouldn't  show that I had available open shifts. The time off that I requested was always for VA (veterans affairs) appointments so my call in's where emergency only. I was always on time with all clients and I gave every client the best treatment, companion care, and respect.
I dislike the company policies with COVID.  I was schedule to go into the office to do some training. I schedule this on my own because I knew that youtube videos couldnt get me by. I needed hands on training. They lack training. When I confirmed with my boss the time to come in for training I was told by my boss that they are not allowing people to come to the office. She sounded really sick on the phone so I couldnt give you a honest reason why they told employees to stay away. If i had to guess covid. I had called into work last minute for a car issue which i got reprimanded and the second issue was because i needed to make sure a relative didnt have covid because i was around them. I got written up and they told me they would fire me if I called in again. Well. I had to call in again because of covid symptoms. I told the boss if covid symptoms is not a valid excuse for calling into work, then i cant work there. I care about the clients health and if it takes me quitting to protect them I had to. You should not send employees to work or threatened them with termination. Im a hard worker so its really sad to see great people like myself to quit. Lastly, is the driving. I would drive about an 1 hour to get to a clients house. Like i said before I loved the job and I know some caregivers dont do right. They dont clean or take care of the clients like they should. So I stayed because there is not enough good in this work place. All in all it was the company saying I have one more call in and they have to fire me. If im sick i cant be around the elderly. They are vulnerable. They need to rethink their procedures.

Now i dont get unemployment, i cant qualify because i receive the Post 9/11 bill money for school. I cant receive unemployment because i am in school and veterans are not allowed to double dip. Meaning i cant get free money from the Post 9/11 bill and money from unemployment. Like i said before i work because I care.

On a positive these are quotes I picked up:

The price you pay for the job you have

Cold hands, warm heart, dirty sweetheart

Keshia

resp.text:
Keshia, we also enjoyed you working for Senior Helpers. We were very proud to have a veteran join our team. The Federal minimum wage is $7.25 an hour. We do pay our employees this for training pay ONLY but once you complete the hiring process and start working with our clients you receive the wage that was discussed during your interview. We do not have a single employee that is working for less than $8.50 an hour. I pulled your check stubs to make sure we did not make a mistake on your pay while you were employed with Senior Helpers and we did not, if you would like  confirmation on your check stubs we would be happy to provide that information to you please just give us a call at our Senior Helpers office (256)650-2982.
When you started working with Senior Helpers we were shorter staffed due to the pandemic and caregivers quitting without notice or calling in for shifts last minute (without COVID-19 symptoms or being in contact with someone who had COVID-19).
I am sorry you felt we lacked training. We have an entire room in our office dedicated to hands on training that you sat in during our orientation. This training room includes: a medical manikin, hospital bed, shower, shower chair, walker, wheel chair, cane, gait belt, slide board, Hoyer lift, a change of sheets to learn to change an occupied bed, ‘depends’ to practice changing and bathing clients, bed side commode to practice safely transferring clients and more are available to any caregiver who would like additional training to come and schedule a time to practice. We just ask you schedule your time in advance to ensure we have sanitized all materials and your supervisor is available to assist you.
As for our COVID-19 policy that you signed and received a copy of in orientation; we ask if you have been exposed or have any COVID-19 symptoms to call the office and we will send you to the nearest clinic to get tested immediately. Your supervisor actually responded to you when you called out with COVID-19 symptoms, “Of course COVID is an acceptable excuse. And are you going to get tested today? If so just send me the paperwork and it will excuse you.” You told us you were going to get tested but you were going to pass on coming back to work for Senior Helpers because you did not like the call-in policy. We respected your decision and removed you from the schedule and just asked as a courtesy for our clients to let us know your COVID-19 test results so we can update them if they need to be tested in the event you tested positive. You responded stating you do not have COVID-19 and have not been exposed therefore they do not need to be tested.
During your interview you agreed to drive up to 30 miles to a client’s home. The furthest you were asked to drive to a client was 25.7 miles and this was not your regular client.
We thought you were a great a caregiver to our clients in the short time you worked for Senior Helpers and you are right, you did truly care for your clients which we greatly appreciated. I am sorry you felt the need to quit from a misunderstanding you may have had with the attendance policy. We wish you nothing but the best in the future for your nursing career. And if you have any other concerns, we hope you will please call us at our office (256)650-2982 and we will be happy to address this with you.

name: Lydia Avery
text: Every care giver that has come to care for my grandmother has been wonderful! She raves about how much she liked everyone that has come from your company! Which isn't always the case with others who have cared for her in the past. I especially appreciate how flexible Senior Helpers has been with being able to find us last minute care when we unexpectedly needed someone. I am SO GLAD we tried Senior Helpers!! You guys are a major blessing to our lives! Finding quality care is not longer difficult or stressful thanks to Senior Helpers!

name: april Taylor
text: BEWARE!! I would not recommend getting a job here! I was not able to complete orientation due to family issues. Ended up not taking the job. They refused to pay for that one day and was very ugly over the phone. Hung up on me twice! Not professional at all!!! So glad I did not take the job. Their true colors definitely came out! text: I highly recommend the services at Home Care Assistance in Birmingham. They were able assist my family in caring for my mother with short notice. text: I cannot say enough about how much stress that Debbie and her team took off of me.  My parents and I were separated by a few states, so it was not possible for me to be on hand to coordinate their care.  Her team worked day and night to take care of their needs.

I thought that sounded so silly at first, but when you see the difference that they are making in people's lives, you realize how true it really is. I would gladly use Home Care Assistance to help with the care of myself and my loved ones for just about anything. ❤️

name: James Patchett
text: I have been working with Debbie and her team for nearly 6 months now and could not be happier with her team and their dedication.  I am thankful every day that I found such a great team to provide care. Thank you for all that you do!

name: cherry johnson
text: This organization is amazing,  they have been that bridge needed to help care for our mother. Debra has been a needed ear for my many frantic late calls, helping to work through the red tape of relocating an elderly parent to a new city, and when you just have no one else. I have moved my mother into an assistant living facility, and no longer use her services, but that has not stopped her from calling to check on my mother.   If you need a trusted agency this is the place to go.

name: Kerry Cavaliere
text: Debra and her staff are always very helpful and attentive. I would not hesitate to recommend their services.

name: Tiffony Coleman
text: There loving, caring, and very compassionate with you and your love one's, they also have the most wonderful staff with big hearts :-) :-) :-)

name: Debbie Young
text: Extremely disappointment. The care provided for my sister was not even close to what we expected. I left and went to Always There In Home care and we will never look back.

resp.text:
Hi Debbie,

Though we appreciate you taking the time to leave our business a review, we believe you may have accidentally picked the wrong Home Care Company to review. To our knowledge, we do not have record of the situation that you have stated in your review. If you will, please give us a call at your convenience. We would like to make sure we better understand what happened and that we do whatever we can to correct any possible errors of ours. We can be reached directly at 205-308-1144 or 205-438-6925. We look forward to hearing from you and apologize for any inconvenience, thank you.

Best Regards,

-The Home Care Assistance Team
